image.altText: Two women walking down stairs, avoiding eye contact with the camera.

props.synopsis: The 32-year-old was working at a plumbing business when it's alleged she took the money over a two-and-a-half year period.

title.children: Woman accused of stealing $700,000 from her workplace through illegitimate invoices and extra salary pleads not guilty

image.altText: A laptop computer sits open on a bed in a dark room showing an email account on screen.

props.synopsis: A psychologist tells the ACT Supreme Court a 30-year-old Canberra woman who recruited a hit man on the dark web to kill her parents did it because she was sexually abused as a young child.

title.children: Court hears Canberra woman recruited hit man on dark web to kill parents due to abuse she suffered as a child

image.altText: a man's silhouette

props.synopsis: He decided tough, decisive and quick action was needed.

title.children: After his son was bullied, this father took out a personal protection order against the teenage perpetrator

image.altText: A smashed up blue car after a fatal accident.

props.synopsis: A coronial inquest has heard "excessive speed, inexperience [and] intoxication" were just some of the factors that likely contributed to the fatal crash that killed a 21-year-old Canberra man in 2022.

title.children: Man who died in Canberra crash was unlicensed and affected by alcohol, inquest hears

image.altText: Damage from a fire in a prison common space.

props.synopsis: A man has been spared more jail time over his role in a 2020 riot at Canberra's jail, which started after prison staff refused to serve dessert or hand out cigarettes.

title.children: Man spared more jail time over Canberra prison riot which caused $1.6 million in damage

image.altText: A man and a woman hold hands and smile at each other while outdoors walking

props.synopsis: While Canberra is one of the least-religious states and territories in the country, for those who adhere to a faith, it's the most important thing in their lives. So what does that look like?

title.children: Meet the faithful — what does religion look like in Canberra?

image.altText: A firefighter at a grassfire in Pialligo near the ACT and NSW border.

props.synopsis: While the Bureau of Meteorology is predicting an "average" fire season for the Canberra region, the biggest risk is expected to come from storms and grass fires.

title.children: As the weather starts to heat up in Canberra, what can you do to prepare for fires and storms?

image.altText: A woman stands in front of microphones, with a man behind her looking at her.

props.synopsis: Many observers believed the Canberra Liberals leadership tussle was a two-way contest. But just like Scott Morrison in 2018, it was a third player who emerged victorious.

title.children: Like Scott Morrison in 2018, few saw this new opposition leader coming

image.altText: A composite image of five people, four men and a woman. Their faces are in boxes.

props.synopsis: Insiders and whistleblowers are troubled by the risks of disinformation, threats to democracy and extreme dangers for young people.

title.children: One by one, these insiders left the world's biggest social media companies. They warn safeguards have been 'cut to the bone'

image.altText: A mobile phone is held in a person's hand at the ASX in Sydney

props.synopsis: The ASX has gained 0.3 per cent in early trade as Westpac's profit disappoints and Mineral Resources founder and MD Chris Ellison has been forced to step down early. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: AFP searches PwC's Sydney offices, while ASX gains ahead of US election

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: ASX 200 gallops home to end 0.6pc higher
ASX up 0.4pc, Westpac recovers early losses

image.altText: A satellite circling the earth.

props.synopsis: A $7 billion plan to create an Australian military-grade satellite communications system announced in April last year has been cancelled as current defence spending is reviewed.

title.children: Major Australian military satellite project axed just 18 months after announcement

image.altText: Man in khaki and wide brim hat stands in front of a group of donkeys

props.synopsis: Chris Henggeler is the only grazier in Australia using feral donkeys to regenerate his remote property. Now he's on the wrong side of the law.

title.children: From desert to oasis : The defiant grazier running a radical regeneration experiment using feral donkeys

image.altText: A child is immunised via droplets into the mouth in a clinic.

props.synopsis: Israel's military denies responsibility for the strike, which occurred during a pause in fighting. UNICEF has described the incident as "disturbing".

title.children: Israeli attacks kill 31 people in Gaza while four children injured in drone strike at polio vaccination centre

image.altText: A modestly dressed king walks down the high street of a Spanish village with body guards and a crowd surrounding him.

props.synopsis: Residents scream "get out" as King Felipe VI and other officials tour one of the worst-hit areas of flood-ravaged Valencia City.

title.children: Spanish king and queen pelted with mud as locals vent anger over government's flooding response

image.altText: Man seen from mouth down sitting with crossed legs with lap-top in lap. He wears shirt and jeans, and has ginger beard.

props.synopsis: Unprecedented legal battles are testing if parent companies of tools like ChatGPT can be liable for defamation when innocent people are incorrectly described as criminals.

title.children: When AI wrongly described this man as a criminal, it thrust him into uncharted legal territory

image.altText: A woman smiling

props.synopsis: A new poll from a pollster rated among country's most reputable predicts Kamala Harris will claim a surprise victory in Iowa — a state her rival Donald Trump had been expected to win easily — as the US presidential campaign enters its final stages.

title.children: US election 'oracle' predicts surprise for Harris as Trump rails at 'fake' poll

image.altText: Vice President Kamala Harris and Australia's Prime Minister Anthony Albanese toast

props.synopsis: The US is Australia's most important military ally, one of our biggest trading partners and a critical diplomatic partner in the Indo-Pacific.

title.children: What a Trump or Harris victory would mean for Australia

image.altText: A Surf Life Saving rescuer pushing a jetski into the water off the beach.

props.synopsis: The boy was trying to cross a channel of water on the NSW Central Coast with his father and brothers when the current swept him away.

title.children: Search resumes for missing 11yo boy swept out to sea at 'dangerous' channel

image.altText: An image of a night sky, lit up by a meteor.

props.synopsis: It will be best viewed late into the evening and early tomorrow morning, but unless you're a night sky enthusiast, then it might not be worth your time.

title.children: Tonight's meteor shower is known for producing very bright fireballs — and you can see it anywhere in Australia

image.altText: Donald Trump puts his finger in an aircraft shelter

props.synopsis: Donald Trump, for all his sins, has proved himself to be an astute politician with an unerring ability to dominate the news cycle and garner attention. As he would see it, all publicity, no matter how awful, really is good publicity.

title.children: Trump can win the election, and the clues to how he got here can be found in his 1997 book

image.altText: A man casts his vote into a mobile ballot box in his living room.

props.synopsis: Maia Sandu has claimed victory in a tense presidential run-off against pro-Russian rival Alexandr Stoianoglo, with almost 95 per cent of the votes counted.

title.children: Pro-EU incumbent Maia Sandu claims victory in Moldova's presidential election

image.altText: A jockey urges his horse to the line in the Melbourne Cup as another horse runs on in the background.

props.synopsis: The Melbourne Cup has changed greatly in 30 years, but some things remain the same. Just ask three-time cup-winning jockey Kerrin McEvoy.

title.children: 'It's not irrevocable, but it is a real disadvantage': The evolving tactics of winning the Melbourne Cup

image.altText: James Van Der Beek revealed he has colorectal cancer, also known as bowel cancer.

props.synopsis: In a statement provided to US media outlet People magazine, the 47-year-old says he has been "privately dealing with this diagnosis".

title.children: Dawson's Creek star James Van Der Beek reveals colorectal cancer diagnosis

image.altText: New Zealand Test players run and celebrate the wicker of Akash Deep.

props.synopsis: Indian legend Sachin Tendulkar calls for "introspection" after India lost a Test series 3-0 at home to New Zealand in victory labelled "the greatest ever" by ex-England captain Michael Vaughan.

title.children: 'A tough pill to swallow' for India as New Zealand wraps up 'greatest ever Test series victory'

image.altText: A young Australian batter has his mouth open as he stretches forward and hits down the ground during a one-day international.

props.synopsis: Australia's international summer of cricket kicks off at the MCG at 2:30pm AEDT, with the first of six limited-overs men's clashes with Pakistan. Follow live text updates and check out the stats in our ScoreCentre.

title.children: ODI live: International summer kicks off at the MCG with ODI against Pakistan

image.altText: A rider dressed in black attempts to hit a bike with a yellow L plate a two other riders ride beside the pair.

props.synopsis: Dashcam footage shows bikies surrounding the L-plater, with one hitting and kicking out at the rider.

title.children: Dashcam footage captures 'cowardly' alleged bikie attack on L-plater on Melbourne freeway

image.altText: A pod of pilot whales in the water with a medium-sized cruise vessel alongside them.

props.synopsis: Riley Grining was skippering a cruise around Tasmania's Macquarie Harbour on Sunday when he received a call to help stop a pod of pilot whales from stranding themselves on a beach.

title.children: 'It could have been way worse': Boats help shepherd whale pod out of Hells Gates to avoid mass stranding

image.altText: Chandler-Mather and Pocock stand on the lawns of parliament chatting, Pocock wearing a wide-brimmed hat.

props.synopsis: Independent senator David Pocock and several teal MPs take up arms on behalf of the federal government to pressure the Greens to back two housing bills before parliament.

title.children: Independents pressure Greens to break housing stalemate after Queensland election losses

image.altText: A bald man in a blue shirt and sweater sits at a drum kit.

props.synopsis: Australia doesn't have enough houses. But there's a hidden capacity in the market which, in theory, could help solve that problem — and it could start with your spare bedroom.

title.children: Australia's housing crisis remains trapped in large, empty homes

image.altText: Woman driving van with dog next to her

props.synopsis: Lesley Larkin's family feels like time is running out to catch her killer as the 40th anniversary of her violent Noosa death approaches.

title.children: 40th anniversary of Lesley Larkin's violent Noosa death approaches, her family remains desperate for answers

image.altText: A snowy mountain summit.

props.synopsis: Yet another group of wannabe adventurers have had to be pulled out of the Tasmanian wilderness after conditions turned on them and wild winds destroyed their tents.

title.children: Hikers rescued from Tasmania's Mount Anne region after weather rips tents apart

image.altText: A man with a shaved head and short bear sits on an esky in a garden holding a fish.

props.synopsis: Emergency services and community members continue the search for missing Maryborough fisherman Darryn Kimlin, after his boat is found on a sandbar.

title.children: Police hold 'serious concerns' for missing Maryborough fisherman after boat found on sandbar

image.altText: Marathon participants run under the Sydney Harbour Bridge

props.synopsis: The milestone follows a three-year candidacy period and a record-breaking Sydney Marathon a few weeks ago where 25,000 runners participated.

title.children: Sydney Marathon to join elite ranks of world marathon majors alongside London and New York City

image.altText: A man with a fluffy hood stands in snow with a sled behind.

props.synopsis: He walked all the way across Australia, skied unsupported through white-outs on an Arctic ice cap, and climbed to the top of snow-covered peaks. Now, this Queenslander is planning his biggest adventure yet.

title.children: From sea to summit, Queensland adventurer embarks on world-first Antarctic expedition

image.altText: Eric Idle, a man in his 80s, wears a tuxedo on a red carpet, with a blue media wall behind him.

props.synopsis: Eric Idle, one-sixth of legendary comedy group Monty Python, brings his new live show, Always Look on the Bright Side of Life, Live!, to Australia this month.

title.children: 'We're not here forever': George Harrison's advice that Eric Idle still lives by
